2026-02-09.content: The Looker Action Hub has been updated to support newer API versions for Google Ads (from v19 to v22) and Facebook Custom Audiences (from v22 to v24).

summary.title: Looker Action Hub API Update
summary.summary: The Looker Action Hub now supports updated API versions for Google Ads and Facebook Custom Audiences. This enhancement ensures continued compatibility and access to the latest features from these platforms.

2026-02-09.content: The [Customer Engineer Advanced Editor](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#customer_engineer_advanced_editor) default role now includes the `gemini_in_looker`, `chat_with_agent`, `chat_with_explore`, and `save_agents` permissions, which grant access to Gemini features and Conversational Analytics functionality.

summary.title: Gemini Features Now Available
summary.summary: The Customer Engineer Advanced Editor role now includes permissions for Gemini features and Conversational Analytics. This update grants access to Gemini in Looker, agent chat, explore chat, and the ability to save agents.

2026-02-09.content: When you use [Elite System Activity](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/elite-system-activity), all System Activity fields of the `longtext` type that have a size greater than 2 MB will be truncated. If a table has only one column with a `longtext` type, that column will be set to a maximum of 1.9 MB in size. If a table has multiple columns of the `longtext` type, the total maximum size across all such columns is 2 MB, and this limit is distributed uniformly among those columns. For example, if a table has `x` `longtext` columns, each column will have a maximum length of 2 MB divided by `x`.

summary.title: System Activity Field Size Limit
summary.summary: System Activity fields of type `longtext` are now subject to size limits to prevent performance issues. Fields larger than 2 MB will be truncated. This change ensures efficient data handling within the system.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where some drill links could fail to work when cookieless embed was enabled. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Drill links fixed with cookieless embed
summary.summary: An issue where drill links failed with cookieless embed enabled has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2026-02-09.content: When you use [Elite System Activity](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/elite-system-activity), the `merge_query` table now refreshes every 10 minutes.

summary.title: Elite System Activity Refresh Rate Increased
summary.summary: The merge_query table for Elite System Activity now refreshes every 10 minutes. This update provides more frequent access to your system activity data.

2026-02-09.content: When you are [delivering content to an SFTP server](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/delivering-looks-explores#delivery_options_for_sftp_servers), additional key exchange algorithms and host key algorithms are now supported.

summary.title: SFTP delivery enhancements
summary.summary: SFTP delivery now supports additional key exchange and host key algorithms. This expands the options available when sending data to SFTP servers, improving compatibility and flexibility.

2026-02-09.content:
An issue has been fixed where the pagination option was not being displayed in the LookML Dashboards folder for some users.
This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Pagination displayed in LookML Dashboards folder
summary.summary: A bug that prevented the pagination option from displaying in the LookML Dashboards folder has been resolved. This feature now functions correctly for all users.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where custom dimensions that were based on numeric fields could be converted to strings, which caused incorrect sorting. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Numeric dimension sorting fixed
summary.summary: We've resolved an issue where custom dimensions based on numeric fields were incorrectly converted to strings, leading to sorting problems. The feature now functions as expected, ensuring accurate sorting of numeric data.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where choosing a non-default color collection and then choosing a custom color in a conditional formatting rule could cause the rule to revert to the default color collection. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Conditional formatting color issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue where conditional formatting rules incorrectly reverted to default colors after selecting custom options has been fixed. The feature now functions as expected, allowing users to apply custom color collections without unexpected changes.

2026-02-09.content:
**Looker 26.2** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Monday, February 9, 2026**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Monday, February 16, 2026**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, February 9, 2026**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Friday, February 27, 2026**

summary.title: Looker 26.2 Release Notes
summary.summary: The Looker 26.2 release is scheduled for February 2026, bringing updates and fixes to both Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) deployments. Key dates include deployment starts on February 9th, with final deployments concluding on February 16th for the original version and February 27th for the Google Cloud core version.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where a modification to the color palette for the "Along a scale..." conditional formatting feature could fail to be saved. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Conditional formatting color palette fix
summary.summary: The issue where modifications to the color palette for the "Along a scale..." conditional formatting feature were not saved has been resolved. This feature now saves and functions correctly.

2026-02-09.content: Now available in preview, Looker has full support for connections with [AlloyDB for PostgreSQL](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-alloydb). When you [create a connection](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connecting-to-your-db) in Looker, you can now select "Google Cloud AlloyDB for PostgreSQL" from the Dialect drop-down menu. This update does not affect existing AlloyDB connections that were created using the PostgreSQL 9.5+ option in the Dialect menu.

summary.title: Looker Now Supports AlloyDB for PostgreSQL
summary.summary: Looker now offers full support for connections with AlloyDB for PostgreSQL in preview. Users can select 'Google Cloud AlloyDB for PostgreSQL' from the Dialect drop-down menu when creating a new connection in Looker. This enhancement simplifies integration for users of both services.

2026-02-09.content:
An issue has been fixed where non-admin users could not favorite
LookML dashboards. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed LookML dashboard favoriting for non-admins
summary.summary: An issue preventing non-admin users from favoriting LookML dashboards has been resolved. This functionality now works correctly, allowing all users to save their preferred dashboards.

2026-02-09.content: The user attribute pairing user interface for [SAML](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-authentication-saml), [LDAP](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-authentication-ldap), and [OpenID Connect](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-authentication-openid-connect) authentication has been updated. A new "Manage Pairings" side panel provides a robust interface for adding, removing, and viewing attribute pairings. This new interface also includes filtering and pagination and allows for a single claim to be associated with multiple Looker user attributes.

summary.title: Updated User Attribute Pairing Interface
summary.summary: The user attribute pairing interface for SAML, LDAP, and OpenID Connect authentication has been updated with a new 'Manage Pairings' side panel. This provides a more robust way to manage attribute pairings, including filtering, pagination, and associating a single claim with multiple user attributes.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker could return a 500 error if a user with one or more single quotes in their name attempted to commit LookML. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: LookML commit error resolved
summary.summary: An issue causing Looker to return a 500 error when users with single quotes in their names committed LookML has been fixed. The feature now functions correctly.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where switching a visualization type from Table to Single Value could carry over unwanted conditional formatting. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Conditional formatting issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue where conditional formatting persisted between visualization types has been fixed. The feature now functions correctly, ensuring a seamless user experience when switching between Table and Single Value visualizations.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where conditional formatting no longer appeared on certain dashboard tiles. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Conditional formatting now visible on dashboard tiles
summary.summary: An issue that prevented conditional formatting from appearing on certain dashboard tiles has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly, ensuring that conditional formatting is displayed as expected.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where changing the collection in a conditional formatting rule could reset styles for the rule. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Conditional formatting styles preserved
summary.summary: An issue where changing the collection in a conditional formatting rule could reset styles has been fixed. The feature now performs as expected, ensuring your styles are maintained.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where the filter bar would automatically expand on dashboard load when the filter location was set to "Right". This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Filter bar behavior corrected
summary.summary: An issue has been fixed where the filter bar would automatically expand on dashboard load when the filter location was set to "Right". This feature now performs as expected.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where switching filter types from `Matches (Advanced)` to another filter type could populate that filter with an incorrect filter configuration. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Filter configuration issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue where switching filter types could lead to incorrect filter configurations has been fixed. The feature now operates as expected, ensuring accurate filter settings.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where adding a new field to a conditionally formatted result set could fail to apply the conditional formatting to the new field. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Conditional formatting now applies to new fields
summary.summary: An issue where new fields in conditionally formatted result sets failed to apply formatting has been resolved. This feature now functions correctly, ensuring all new fields are properly formatted.

2026-02-09.content: An issue has been fixed where dashboard tiles with titles that included the % symbol could not be downloaded in the Safari 26.0 browser. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Dashboard tile download issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue preventing dashboard tiles with titles containing the '%' symbol from being downloaded in Safari 26.0 has been fixed. This functionality now works correctly.

2026-02-09.content: Looker admins can now [grant essential Google Cloud services](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-server-ip-allowlist), such as [Conversational Analytics](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/conversational-analytics-overview), access to a Looker instance, even when an IP allowlist is active.

summary.title: Allow essential services through IP allowlists
summary.summary: Looker admins can now grant essential Google Cloud services, like Conversational Analytics, access to a Looker instance even when an IP allowlist is active. This ensures critical features remain accessible without compromising security.

2026-02-09.content: Looker admins can now enforce a [password expiration policy](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-authentication-password#setting_password_expiration), enhancing security for users who authenticate with an email and a password. This new feature lets admins set a password expiration window between 30 and 365 days. Fourteen days before password expiration, a banner will notify the user, and, once their password has expired, the user must reset it at the next login.

summary.title: Password expiration policy is now available
summary.summary: Looker admins can now enforce a password expiration policy. This feature allows admins to set a password expiration window between 30 and 365 days, with users being notified 14 days prior to expiration and required to reset their password upon next login after expiration.

2026-02-06.content: The DataRobot [action](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/actions-overview) is now deprecated. This action is no longer available in the Looker Action Hub.

summary.title: DataRobot action deprecated
summary.summary: The DataRobot action is now deprecated and no longer available in the Looker Action Hub.

2026-02-02.content: Conversational Analytics now displays its reasoning for how it analyzes queries. After you enter your query, click [**Show reasoning**](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/conversational-analytics-looker-data#show-reasoning) to see a plain text explanation of the steps that Conversational Analytics took to interpret your query.

summary.title: New conversational analytics feature
summary.summary: Conversational Analytics now shows its reasoning. After entering a query, click "Show reasoning" to see a plain text explanation of how your query was interpreted.

2026-01-28.content: You can now view the public [egress IP addresses](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-view-console#details_tab) for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use Private Service Connect and controlled native egress. These IP addresses may be used when setting up [outbound connections](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-create-psc#configure-outbound).

summary.title: View Egress IP Addresses for Private Service Connect
summary.summary: You can now view the public egress IP addresses for Looker instances using Private Service Connect and controlled native egress. These IP addresses are useful for configuring outbound connections. This feature enhances network management for your Looker deployments.

2026-01-26.content: **Available January 29, 2026:** Conversational Analytics includes a **Show reasoning** toggle that provides step-by-step insight into how the agent reaches its answers. This update also includes improvements to overall answer accuracy. See the [Conversational Analytics API](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/conversational-analytics-api/overview) documentation for details.

summary.title: Conversational Analytics: New Reasoning Feature
summary.summary: Conversational Analytics now offers a 'Show reasoning' toggle, providing detailed explanations for agent responses. This update enhances answer accuracy and offers deeper insights into the AI's decision-making process.

2026-01-26.content:
Updates to the [Continuous Integration (CI)](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/continuous-integration) feature will be available in February, 2026.

**Note:** This item was added on January 28, 2026 and updated on January 30, 2026.

summary.title: CI Feature Updates Coming February 2026
summary.summary: The Continuous Integration (CI) feature is receiving updates. These enhancements will be available starting February 2026. This update aims to improve the CI workflow for users.

2026-01-26.content: Gemini in Looker can now [generate a summary and an analysis of an Explore](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/explore-summary-gemini).

summary.title: Gemini adds analysis to Explores
summary.summary: Gemini in Looker now offers automated summaries and analyses for your data explorations. This new feature helps you quickly understand key insights from your Explores, saving you time and effort in data analysis.

2026-01-26.content: Now available in preview, the [**Configuration** tab of the **Projects Settings** page](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/git-options#configuration) in the Looker IDE contains a **Delete Developer Copy** button that lets LookML developers delete their local developer copy of the project's Git repository. See the [Using version control and deploying](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/version-control-and-deploying-changes#delete-dev-copy) documentation page for details.

summary.title: Delete Developer Copy Feature
summary.summary: LookML developers can now delete their local developer copy of a project's Git repository using a new button in the Project Settings. This feature is currently in preview and can be accessed via the Configuration tab within the Looker IDE. Refer to the documentation for detailed instructions on using this new functionality.

2026-01-26.content: **Looker 26.0** includes the following feature updates, which will start rolling out on January 26, 2026:

summary.title: Looker 26.0 Feature Updates Rolling Out Soon
summary.summary: Looker 26.0 is set to release new feature updates starting January 26, 2026. This release brings enhancements designed to improve the Looker experience for users. Stay tuned for more details on the specific improvements.

2026-01-26.content: The [**Self-service Explores** admin page](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-self-service-explore) now supports a connection test button so that Looker admins can verify that the BigQuery connection is able to support self-service Explores.

summary.title: Connection Test for Self-service Explores
summary.summary: Looker admins can now test BigQuery connections directly from the Self-service Explores admin page. This feature ensures that your connections are ready to support self-service Explores, improving setup and reliability.

2026-01-26.content:
The [Tabbed Dashboards Labs feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs#tabbed-dashboards) is now available. The Tabbed Dashboards Labs feature lets dashboard editors organize dashboard content across multiple tabs within a single dashboard. Adding tabs to dashboards lets you do the following:

* Better organize content: Group related visualizations and tiles into separate tabs.
* Improve data storytelling: Guide viewers through different aspects of your data in a structured way.
* Enhance performance: Load only the tiles on an active tab, potentially speeding up initial dashboard load times.
* Reduce clutter: Consolidate multiple related analyses into a single dashboard.

This feature is only for Looker (original) instances and is enabled by default.

summary.title: Organize dashboards with tabs
summary.summary: Dashboard editors can now organize content across multiple tabs within a single dashboard using the new Tabbed Dashboards feature. This helps improve organization, data storytelling, and performance by consolidating related analyses and loading only active tabs.

2026-01-26.content:
The [Dashboard Filter Enhancements Labs feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs#dashboard-filter-enhancements) is now available. The Dashboard Filter Enhancements Labs feature includes the following improvements:

* Persistent filter suggestion drop-down: Filter suggestion drop-downs remain open for easier multi-selection for [tag list](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/filters-user-defined-dashboards#tag-list) and [advanced filter type](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/filters-user-defined-dashboards#advanced_filters) filters.
* Select or deselect all filter values: Lets users select or deselect all values in tag list and advanced filter type filters.
* Limit condition controls for advanced filters: Lets dashboard creators limit the condition options that are available to users for advanced filters.
* Enable [Include custom filter values](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/presenting-content#adding_dashboards_to_boards_with_custom_filter_values_applied) by default for boards: Admins can choose to enable Include custom filter values for boards by default instance-wide.

This feature is only for Looker (original) instances and is enabled by default.

summary.title: Dashboard Filter Enhancements Now Available
summary.summary: The Dashboard Filter Enhancements Labs feature is now generally available, offering improvements like persistent filter suggestion drop-downs, select/deselect all options, and limit condition controls for advanced filters. This feature, available for Looker (original) instances, also allows admins to enable 'Include custom filter values' by default for boards.

2026-01-26.content:
The [Custom Tooltips Labs feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs#custom-tooltips) is now available. The Custom Tooltips Labs feature lets you configure tooltips within the Explore [visualization editor](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/creating-visualizations#quick_guide) using a combination of UI settings and an HTML editor that supports Liquid templating.

This feature is only for Looker (original) instances and is enabled by default.

summary.title: Custom Tooltips Now Available
summary.summary: The Custom Tooltips Labs feature is now generally available. This feature allows you to customize tooltips in the visualization editor using UI settings and Liquid templating. It is enabled by default for Looker (original) instances.

2026-01-14.content: Looker (Google Cloud core) is now available in the asia-southeast3 (Bangkok) region. For more information, see the [Looker (Google Cloud core) locations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-locations#asia-pacific) documentation.

summary.title: Looker available in Bangkok region
summary.summary: Looker (Google Cloud core) is now deployed in the asia-southeast3 (Bangkok) region, expanding its availability to a new location. This enhancement allows users in the region to access Looker with reduced latency. For more details on supported locations, please refer to the official documentation.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker would generate inefficient SQL for some Databricks queries that included date manipulation for weekly data. Looker now uses Databricks functions like `date_trunc` when generating SQL.

summary.title: Databricks weekly date queries improved
summary.summary: An issue causing inefficient SQL for Databricks weekly date queries has been resolved. Looker now utilizes Databricks functions like `date_trunc` for better performance.

2026-01-08.content: For the Spanish (`es_ES`) locale, the weekday initials for Sunday and Tuesday in the schedule dashboard dialog have been set to the correct values (`D` and `M`).

summary.title: Weekday initials fixed
summary.summary: The weekday initials for Sunday and Tuesday in the Spanish locale have been corrected in the schedule dashboard dialog. Previously, `D` and `M` were incorrectly displayed.

2026-01-08.content: The JDBC driver for [Apache Spark 3+](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-apache-spark) connections has been updated to version 2.7.6.

summary.title: New JDBC Driver Version
summary.summary: The JDBC driver for Apache Spark 3+ connections has been updated to version 2.7.6. This update ensures improved compatibility and performance for your data analysis workflows.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where applying filters to a Google Map visualization would require a refresh before the filters would take effect. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Map filter issue resolved
summary.summary: The issue where filters on Google Map visualizations required a refresh to take effect has been fixed. The feature now functions correctly, applying filters immediately as expected.

2026-01-08.content: [Custom mail settings that are configured for SMTP servers](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-platform-smtp) now support OAuth 2.0 authentication.

summary.title: SMTP Mail Settings Support OAuth 2.0
summary.summary: Custom SMTP mail settings now support OAuth 2.0 authentication, enhancing security and simplifying connection management. This update allows for more robust and modern authentication methods when configuring email delivery.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where some columns in the Query Concurrency System Activity Explore were displaying null values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Query Concurrency System Activity Fix
summary.summary: An issue causing null values in Query Concurrency System Activity Explore columns has been resolved. The feature is now functioning correctly.

2026-01-08.content: For [creating self-service Explores](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/exploring-self-service) from Excel files that contain multiple worksheets, the **Data upload** dialog now lets you specify which Excel worksheet to upload. Previously, the self-service Explore was always based on the first worksheet in the Excel file. **Note:** This item was added on January 15, 2026.

summary.title: Upload specific Excel worksheets for self-service Explores
summary.summary: You can now choose which worksheet to upload from an Excel file when creating self-service Explores. Previously, only the first worksheet was used. This enhancement provides greater flexibility for data analysis from multi-sheet Excel files.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where a join wouldn't be added to the query, even if one was required by a measure of type `count_distinct`, `sum_distinct`, or `avg_distinct`.

summary.title: Fixed issue with join conditions
summary.summary: An issue has been resolved where certain distinct aggregate measures were not correctly including join conditions in queries. This fix ensures that joins are properly added when required by measures like count_distinct, sum_distinct, or avg_distinct, leading to more accurate query results.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker would prevent users from uploading data if they lacked the `explore` permission. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Data upload issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue that prevented users from uploading data due to missing permissions has been fixed. Looker will now allow data uploads as expected, regardless of the `explore` permission.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where testing a connection could fail to return an error message in cases where the user had insufficient permissions or if the connection no longer existed. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Connection testing error handling improved
summary.summary: An issue where connection testing failed to return error messages for insufficient permissions or non-existent connections has been resolved. The feature now correctly displays errors when applicable, ensuring expected behavior.

2026-01-08.content: The LookML dashboards folder is now paginated, showing 30 dashboards per page.

summary.title: Dashboard Folder Pagination
summary.summary: The LookML dashboard folder now displays 30 dashboards per page, improving navigation and organization. This pagination enhances the user experience by making it easier to manage and find specific dashboards within large collections.

2026-01-08.content: When you use the Field Picker to clear all fields, the chart type no longer changes to Table (Legacy).

summary.title: Field Picker behavior corrected
summary.summary: The chart type will no longer change to Table (Legacy) when clearing all fields using the Field Picker. This resolves a previous issue where the chart visualization was unexpectedly altered.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where strings with accented characters were not being displayed properly in the Y-Axis of a visualization. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Accent characters displayed correctly in visualizations
summary.summary: An issue causing improper display of strings with accented characters in visualization Y-Axes has been resolved. The feature now functions as expected, ensuring accurate character rendering.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the Get LookML Model Explore API endpoint could time out without returning results. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: API Endpoint Timeout Fix
summary.summary: An issue causing the Get LookML Model Explore API endpoint to time out has been resolved. The endpoint now returns results as expected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where manually resetting column widths from a dashboard grid tile header had no effect. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Column width reset fixed
summary.summary: The issue where manually resetting column widths in dashboard grid tiles was not working has been resolved. Column width adjustments now function correctly as intended.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where long content in tooltips could not be scrolled. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Tooltip scrolling issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue preventing scrolling of long content within tooltips has been fixed. Tooltips now function correctly, allowing users to view all content as expected.

2026-01-08.content: A retry limit has been added for scheduled jobs. If a scheduled job fails five times in a row, then it's skipped until the next time the schedule is triggered.

summary.title: Job Retry Limit Implemented
summary.summary: A retry limit has been introduced for scheduled jobs. Jobs failing five consecutive times will now be skipped until the next schedule trigger, improving system stability.

2026-01-08.content: HTML characters are now displayed in plaintext in table visualizations to match other visualization types. For example, `"` is no longer rendered as `"`.

summary.title: Plaintext HTML in tables
summary.summary: HTML characters are now displayed in plaintext in table visualizations, aligning with other visualization types. This change ensures consistency by preventing characters like `"` from being rendered as their decoded equivalents.

2026-01-08.content:
**Looker 26.0** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Monday, January 12, 2026**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Monday, January 19, 2026**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, January 12, 2026**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Friday, January 23, 2026**

summary.title: Looker 26.0 Release Details
summary.summary: Looker 26.0 is scheduled for release in January 2026. Key dates include deployment starts on January 12th for both original and Google Cloud core versions. Final deployment and download availability vary, with the original version concluding on January 19th and the Google Cloud core version on January 23rd.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where, after you uploaded data, Looker would not redirect you to the uploaded file. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Upload redirection fixed
summary.summary: An issue where Looker did not redirect to the uploaded file after upload has been resolved. The feature now works as expected.

2026-01-08.content: Looker now supports encrypted files for [key-pair authentication for Snowflake connections](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-snowflake#key-pair).

summary.title: Encrypted files for Snowflake connections
summary.summary: Looker now supports encrypted files for key-pair authentication with Snowflake connections. This enhances security for your data by allowing you to use encrypted files for authentication, ensuring your connection details remain protected.

2026-01-08.content: The **Skip to Main Content** accessibility link for dashboards has been removed for embedded dashboards.

summary.title: Accessibility link removed from embedded dashboards
summary.summary: The 'Skip to Main Content' accessibility link has been removed for embedded dashboards. This change improves the user experience by streamlining navigation within these specific dashboard views.

2026-01-08.content: When you [view folders on embedded content](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/viewing-embedded-items#viewing_folders_on_embedded_looks_explores_and_dashboards), LookML dashboards are now visible. The LookML dashboards folder, however, will not be visible.

summary.title: LookML dashboards visible in embedded content
summary.summary: LookML dashboards are now visible when viewing folders on embedded content. Note that the LookML dashboards folder itself will not be displayed.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where a SQL Runner query against a model would fail if the user had not yet opened the model in Development Mode. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fix for SQL Runner model access
summary.summary: An issue where SQL Runner queries failed for users without Development Mode access has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly, ensuring seamless querying regardless of model access status.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where merged queries could disappear if a user edited one of the settings in the Values tab for a field. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Merged queries fixed
summary.summary: An issue where merged queries could disappear when editing field settings has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly, ensuring your queries are preserved.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been identified and fixed in search where the latency in fetching search results spiked, causing search to be slow in returning results. A layer of caching has been added, causing search results to be more performant. **Note:** This item was added on January 13, 2026.

summary.title: Search performance improved
summary.summary: A fix has been implemented to address search latency issues. By introducing a caching layer, search results will now be returned more quickly, improving overall performance.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the custom tooltip editor was unable to scroll to edit long tooltip templates. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Tooltip editor scrolling fixed
summary.summary: An issue preventing scrolling in the custom tooltip editor for long templates has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where tooltip background colors were not being correctly rendered. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Tooltip background colors fixed
summary.summary: An issue with tooltip background colors not rendering correctly has been resolved. The feature now functions as expected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where certain fields in dialogs, such as the Format field in the Download dialog, were incorrectly labeled as read-only to screen readers. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Screen reader labels corrected
summary.summary: An issue where certain fields were incorrectly labeled as read-only to screen readers has been resolved. This fix ensures that field accessibility now functions as expected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the dialog to select a folder would attempt to load a second page of results without being prompted by the user. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Folder selection dialog fixed
summary.summary: The folder selection dialog no longer loads a second page of results unexpectedly. This issue is now resolved, and the feature performs as expected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where `value_format` was not respected in table visualizations for numeric values larger than 16 digits. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Numeric value formatting in tables fixed
summary.summary: An issue causing incorrect formatting for numeric values exceeding 16 digits in table visualizations has been resolved. The `value_format` setting will now be correctly applied to all numeric data.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where selecting the filter option "is before N hours ago" incorrectly displayed "is before N hours" in the filter.

summary.title: Filter bug fixed
summary.summary: An issue where the 'is before N hours ago' filter displayed incorrectly has been resolved. The filter now shows the correct text.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker extensions could not access webpack development servers. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Looker Extension webpack Fix
summary.summary: An issue preventing Looker extensions from accessing webpack development servers has been resolved. This functionality now operates correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where filters with commas were not including all filter conditions on Safari browsers. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Filter issue resolved
summary.summary: An issue where filters with commas were not including all conditions on Safari has been fixed. The feature now functions correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where a table visualization could become unresponsive if a fixed column width was specified for multiple columns. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Table visualization fix
summary.summary: Resolved an issue where table visualizations became unresponsive with multiple fixed column widths. The feature now works correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where downloading pivoted queries with table calculations while using an Exasol database could return an error. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Pivoted Query Downloads Now Functional
summary.summary: An issue preventing the download of pivoted queries with table calculations on Exasol databases has been resolved. This functionality now works correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where any Liquid usage in a derived table SQL resulted in full suggestions behavior. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed an issue with derived table SQL suggestions
summary.summary: An issue where Liquid usage in derived tables caused full suggestion behavior has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly as intended.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where clicking **Status details** in the connection setup page without first selecting a dialect caused the page to crash. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed connection setup crash
summary.summary: An issue where clicking 'Status details' without selecting a dialect caused a crash has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where modifying conditional formatting rules other than the first one incorrectly affected the first rule. This fix has been backported to Looker versions 25.18.41 and 25.20.17.

summary.title: Conditional formatting fix
summary.summary: An issue where modifying conditional formatting rules incorrectly affected the first rule has been resolved. This fix is available in Looker versions 25.18.41 and 25.20.17.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the **Show More** button wouldn't appear for large lists when a user was managing folder access. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Folder access management UI improved
summary.summary: The **Show More** button now correctly appears for large lists when managing folder access, ensuring full functionality. This issue has been resolved, and the feature now performs as expected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where custom measures with invalid field references could cause queries to fail, even if those measures weren't selected in the query. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed invalid field references in custom measures
summary.summary: An issue where custom measures with invalid field references could cause queries to fail has been resolved. The feature now performs as expected, ensuring queries function correctly regardless of whether invalid measures are selected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the LookML Validator was not surfacing errors if an invalid field name was referenced in a `suggest_dimension` field. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: LookML Validator Error Surfacing Fixed
summary.summary: The LookML Validator now correctly surfaces errors when an invalid field name is referenced in a `suggest_dimension` field. This resolves a previously existing issue where such errors were not being displayed.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where very long dashboard names were not properly truncated. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Dashboard name truncation fixed
summary.summary: An issue with long dashboard names not being truncated has been resolved. The truncation feature now functions correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where an empty `sorts:` property in a LookML `explore` file definition could cause Looker to return a 500 error. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Empty sorts property fix
summary.summary: An issue causing a 500 error due to an empty `sorts:` property in LookML explore definitions has been resolved. Looker now functions correctly when this property is empty.

2026-01-08.content: When you use [Elite System Activity](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/elite-system-activity), the System Activity field `scheduled_plan.filters_string` is limited to a length of 1.9 MB. Any data beyond the 1.9 MB limit is truncated.

summary.title: System Activity Field Truncation
summary.summary: The System Activity field `scheduled_plan.filters_string` is limited to 1.9 MB. Data exceeding this limit will be truncated when using Elite System Activity. This may affect the completeness of your scheduled plan filter information.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where tooltips incorrectly displayed the text `[object Object]`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Tooltips now display correctly
summary.summary: An issue causing tooltips to display '[object Object]' has been resolved. The feature now functions as intended, providing accurate information.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the **Explore from SQL Runner query** feature could return an error if it found Liquid syntax in the query. The feature now exports the query as plaintext.

summary.title: SQL Runner query export fixed
summary.summary: An issue where the Explore from SQL Runner query feature returned an error due to Liquid syntax has been fixed. The feature now correctly exports queries as plaintext.

2026-01-08.content: The new LookML parameter [`autogenerate_primary_keys`](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-explore-autogenerate-primary-keys) parameter is now supported. When a view or Explore is defined with `autogenerate_primary_keys: yes`, Looker generates a temporary, distinct key for a view, allowing symmetric aggregates and one-to-many counts to be calculated correctly without any changes to your underlying database table. The primary key is generated at query runtime; it does not persist across queries. **Note:** This item was added on January 12, 2026.

summary.title: New LookML parameter for primary key generation
summary.summary: Looker now supports the `autogenerate_primary_keys` parameter in LookML. This allows Looker to create temporary primary keys at query runtime, improving the accuracy of aggregate calculations without modifying your database.

2026-01-08.content: The JDBC driver for [Databricks](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-databricks) connections has been updated to version 3.0.5.

summary.title: Updated JDBC driver for Databricks
summary.summary: The JDBC driver for Databricks connections has been updated to version 3.0.5. This update ensures improved compatibility and performance when connecting to your Databricks data sources.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where filtered custom measures could fail to load if they referenced a dimension that used the `alias` parameter in their filter. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed custom measure loading issue
summary.summary: An issue where filtered custom measures could fail to load due to aliased dimensions has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where the **Show Totals** option in the Plot menu was not correctly hiding totals when a user downloaded results. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fix for download totals issue
summary.summary: The 'Show Totals' option in the Plot menu was not hiding totals correctly during downloads. This has been fixed and the feature now works as expected.

2026-01-08.content: The user interface for configuring group mappings for LDAP, SAML, and OpenID Connect has been updated for improved management. The new interface allows administrators to more easily add, edit, remove, and search for group mappings.

summary.title: Easier group mapping configuration
summary.summary: Group mapping configuration for LDAP, SAML, and OpenID Connect has been improved with a new user interface. Administrators can now more easily add, edit, remove, and search for group mappings, streamlining the management process.

2026-01-08.content: Looker now supports conditional formatting rules for string types in single value and table visualizations.

summary.title: Conditional Formatting for Strings
summary.summary: Looker now supports conditional formatting for string types in single value and table visualizations. This allows for more dynamic and visually informative data representation.

2026-01-08.content: Looker now supports key-pair authentication in the [PDT overrides for Snowflake connections](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-snowflake#pdt-overrides).

summary.title: Looker adds key-pair authentication for Snowflake PDTs
summary.summary: Looker now supports key-pair authentication for PDT overrides on Snowflake connections. This enhancement provides a more secure and flexible way to manage your database configurations. You can now leverage this feature for improved security and easier management of your Snowflake data.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where downloaded reports with pivoted tables could contain extra whitespace. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed report whitespace issue
summary.summary: An issue causing extra whitespace in downloaded reports with pivoted tables has been resolved. Reports will now display correctly without unintended spacing. This functionality is now performing as expected.

2026-01-08.content: An issue has been fixed where creating a custom dimension with a single letter name could cause the query to fail. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Custom dimension naming fixed
summary.summary: An issue that caused queries to fail when creating a custom dimension with a single letter name has been resolved. This functionality now operates correctly.

2026-01-08.content:
The [**Tabbed Dashboards** Labs feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs#tabbed-dashboards) lets dashboard editors organize dashboard content across multiple tabs within a single dashboard. Adding tabs to dashboards lets you do the following:

* **Better organize content:** Group related visualizations and tiles into separate tabs.
* **Improve data storytelling:** Guide viewers through different aspects of your data in a structured way.
* **Enhance performance:** Load only the tiles on an active tab, potentially speeding up initial dashboard load times.
* **Reduce clutter:** Consolidate multiple related analyses into a single dashboard.

This feature will be available beginning January 26, for Looker (Original) instances, and will be disabled by default.

**Note:** This item was updated on January 20, 2026.

summary.title: Organize dashboards with tabs
summary.summary: Organize your dashboard content into multiple tabs for better clarity and performance. This new feature allows you to group related visualizations, improve data storytelling, and reduce clutter by consolidating analyses into a single dashboard. Tabs will be available for Looker (Original) instances starting January 26 and will be disabled by default.

2026-01-08.content: Looker admins can now create dedicated [service accounts for API-only access](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-users#service-account). Additionally, eligible standard user accounts that are being used for API access can be [migrated](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-users#migrating) to the new service account type from the Users page in the Admin panel.

summary.title: API Access with Service Accounts
summary.summary: Looker admins can now create dedicated service accounts for API-only access. Existing standard user accounts used for API access can be migrated to these new service accounts directly from the Admin panel.

2026-01-08.content: The **Favoriting LookML Dashboards** Labs feature, which enables LookML dashboards to be [marked as favorites](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/finding-content#navigating_to_content_in_folders) and displays them on the Looker Favorites tab, is now out of Labs and generally available.

summary.title: Favoriting LookML Dashboards Now Generally Available
summary.summary: You can now mark LookML dashboards as favorites and find them on the Looker Favorites tab. This feature, previously in Labs, is now generally available for all users.

2026-01-08.content:
The [**Custom Tooltips** Labs feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs#custom-tooltips) lets you configure tooltips within the [Explore visualization editor](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/creating-visualizations#quick_guide) using a combination of UI settings and an HTML editor that supports Liquid templating.

This feature will be available beginning January 26, for Looker (Original) instances, and will be enabled by default.

**Note:** This item was updated on January 20, 2026.

summary.title: Customize Tooltips in Explore
summary.summary: Introducing Custom Tooltips, a new Labs feature for Looker. This enhancement allows for more flexible tooltip configuration within the Explore visualization editor, utilizing UI settings and Liquid templating for richer data display. The feature will be available by default for Looker (Original) instances starting January 26.

2026-01-08.content: The API endpoint `search_lookml_dashboards` is out of Labs and now generally available.

summary.title: Search LookML Dashboards GA
summary.summary: The API endpoint search_lookml_dashboards is now generally available. This feature allows you to search LookML dashboards.

2026-01-08.content:
The [**Dashboard Filter Enhancements** Labs feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs#dashboard-filter-enhancements) includes the following improvements:

* Persistent filter suggestion drop-down: Filter suggestion drop-downs remain open for easier multi-selection for [tag list](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/filters-user-defined-dashboards#tag-list) and [advanced filter](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/filters-user-defined-dashboards#advanced_filters) type filters.
* Select or deselect all filter values: Lets users select or deselect all values in tag list and advanced filter type filters.
* Limit condition controls for advanced filters: Lets dashboard creators limit the condition options that are available to users for advanced filters.
* Enable [**Include custom filter values**](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/presenting-content#adding_dashboards_to_boards_with_custom_filter_values_applied) by default for boards: Admins can choose to enable **Include custom filter values for boards** by default instance-wide.

This feature will be available beginning January 26, for Looker (Original) instances, and will be enabled by default.

**Note:** This item was updated on January 20, 2026.

summary.title: New Dashboard Filter Features
summary.summary: Enhancements to dashboard filters include persistent suggestion drop-downs, select/deselect all functionality, and limited condition controls for advanced filters. Admins can also enable custom filter values by default for boards. These improvements aim to streamline the filtering experience for users and creators.

2026-01-08.content: LookML dashboards can now be [marked as favorites](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/finding-content#navigating_to_content_in_folders), allowing the LookML dashboards to appear on the Looker Favorites tab.

summary.title: Mark Dashboards as Favorites
summary.summary: You can now mark LookML dashboards as favorites. These favorited dashboards will then appear on the Looker Favorites tab for quick access.

2026-01-08.content: Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use Private Service Connect can now connect to Google APIs through [controlled native egress](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#controlled-native-egress).

summary.title: Private Looker Instances Get Native Egress
summary.summary: Looker instances using Private Service Connect now have access to Google APIs via controlled native egress. This enhancement simplifies connectivity and improves security for private Looker deployments. It allows for more robust and manageable network configurations.

2026-01-08.content: The API endpoint `search_lookml_dashboards` is now generally available.

summary.title: Search LookML Dashboards API Now Available
summary.summary: The API endpoint `search_lookml_dashboards` has reached general availability. This feature allows users to efficiently search for LookML dashboards. It is now ready for production use.

2025-12-23.content: Historical data cannot be accessed with the API Usage System Activity Explore for Looker instances that are running Looker 25.16 or later. Looker instances that are running Looker 25.16 or later must use the [API Usage Hourly System Activity Explore](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/usage-reports-with-system-activity-explores#api_usage_hourly).

summary.title: API Usage System Activity Explore Update
summary.summary: Access to historical data in the API Usage System Activity Explore is changing for Looker instances version 25.16 and later. Please use the API Usage Hourly System Activity Explore for historical data going forward.

2025-12-03.content: For Looker instances that are running Looker 25.20 or later, admins can now [test the connection](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-platform-actions) between their instance and the Looker Action Hub. This option is available only for the Looker Action Hub. It is not available for [custom action hubs](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/action-hub#setting_up_a_local_action_hub_server).

summary.title: Test Action Hub Connection
summary.summary: Admins of Looker instances running version 25.20 or later can now test the connection to the Looker Action Hub. This new feature, available exclusively for the standard Action Hub, helps ensure seamless integration and functionality.

2025-12-03.content: Now available in preview, the [**Self-service Explore**](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/exploring-self-service) feature lets Looker users upload CSV, XLS, and XLSX files to Looker and then query and visualize the data in a Looker Explore without needing to configure a LookML model or set up Git version control. In addition, [content certification](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/content-certification) is supported for self-service Explores.

summary.title: Self-service Explore
summary.summary: Users can now upload spreadsheets to Looker and explore the data without LookML or Git setup.

2025-12-02.content: Now available in preview, Looker can display a new [**Connected Sheets**](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connected-sheets-quicklink) option in the **Explore actions** menu. The **Connected Sheets** option opens Google Sheets and initiates a connection from Google Sheets to the Looker Explore. You can then build reports, pivot tables, or charts within the newly created Google Sheets using the fields available from the selected Looker Explore. The **Connected Sheets** quick link feature must be configured in the Google Cloud console and on your Looker instance. See the [Connected Sheets quick link](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connected-sheets-quicklink#admin-config) documentation page for details.

summary.title: Connected Sheets in Looker
summary.summary: Looker now offers a Connected Sheets option in preview, allowing you to easily connect to Google Sheets and build reports using Looker data directly within Sheets.

2025-12-01.content: You can now use [Google-managed certificates](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-custom-domain-google-managed-certs) for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use Private Service Connect connections. This feature simplifies custom domain configuration by using a `*.private.looker.app` domain, eliminating the need to manage your own SSL certificates. Instances may need to [migrate](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-psc-migration) to the updated service attachment URI.

summary.title: New Google-managed certificates for Looker
summary.summary: Looker now supports Google-managed certificates for instances using Private Service Connect. This simplifies custom domain setup with a `*.private.looker.app` domain, removing the need for manual SSL certificate management.

2025-12-01.content: You can now use [global access](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-psc-overview#using_global_access) with Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use Private Service Connect connections. Instances may need to [migrate](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-psc-migration) to the updated service attachment URI.

summary.title: Global Access Now Available for Looker PSC
summary.summary: Looker instances using Private Service Connect now support Global Access. Migration to the updated service attachment URI may be required.

2025-12-01.content: The LookerTableau BI Connector is now available on [Tableau Exchange](https://exchange.tableau.com/products/1097). This means that for [Tableau Desktop](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/tableau-connector#desktop) and [Tableau Server](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/tableau-admin#server), you no longer need to manually download and install the Tableau connector (TACO) file. **Note:** This item was added on December 12, 2025.

summary.title: Looker-Tableau BI Connector Now on Tableau Exchange
summary.summary: The LookerTableau BI Connector is now available on Tableau Exchange, simplifying integration for Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server users. This eliminates the need for manual TACO file downloads and installations.

2025-12-01.content:
The LookerTableau BI Connector is now supported for Tableau Cloud, so that you can use a Looker Explore as a data source in Tableau Cloud. See the [LookerTableau BI Connector](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/tableau-connector#cloud) documentation page for more information.

To use the LookerTableau BI Connector with Tableau Cloud, your admin must configure your Looker instance and your Tableau Cloud instance as described on the [Administering Tableau to Looker connections](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/tableau-admin#cloud) documentation page.

summary.title: LookerTableau BI Connector Now Available for Tableau Cloud
summary.summary: The LookerTableau BI Connector now supports Tableau Cloud, allowing you to use Looker Explores as a data source. This feature enables seamless integration between the two platforms for enhanced data analysis.

2025-11-26.content: The DataRobot [action](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/actions-overview) will be deprecated on February 1, 2026. After that date, this action won't be available in the Looker Action Hub.

summary.title: DataRobot action deprecated
summary.summary: The DataRobot action will be deprecated on February 1, 2026, and will not be available in the Looker Action Hub after that date.

2025-11-17.content: The [content certification](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/content-certification) feature, when enabled, lets trusted users certify Looker dashboards and Looks to indicate that the content has gone through a manual review and is certified as reliable and trustworthy. This lets other users identify reliable content and confidently use that data for decision-making. **Note:** This item was updated on November 20, 2025.

summary.title: Content Certification
summary.summary: Certify Looker dashboards and Looks to indicate that the content has gone through a manual review and is certified as reliable and trustworthy. This lets other users identify reliable content and confidently use that data for decision-making.

2025-11-12.content:
[Conversational Analytics](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/conversational-analytics-overview) is now generally available for Looker instances that are on Looker 25.18 or later. Use of Conversational Analytics in your Looker instance is now available without a Looker admin having to enable the **Trusted Testers** settings. Enablement of the **Gemini in Looker** setting is still required. Enablement of the **Trusted Tester Features** setting is still required when using the [Code Interpreter](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/conversational-analytics-looker-code-interpreter) with Conversational Analytics in Looker.

For Looker (Google Cloud core) instances, this launch includes support for Conversational Analytics in instances that are within a VPC perimeter.

See the [Looker pricing](https://cloud.google.com/looker/pricing) page for pricing information.

(This release note was updated on November 13, 2025 to add pricing information.)

summary.title: Conversational Analytics Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Conversational Analytics for Looker is now generally available for instances on Looker 25.18+. No admin enablement is required, but Gemini in Looker must be enabled. Support for VPC-perimeter instances is included. Pricing details are available on the Looker pricing page.

2025-11-11.content: You can now schedule a daily, zero-downtime export for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances. For more information, see the [Create a scheduled export job for a Looker (Google Cloud core) instance](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-scheduled-export) documentation page. This feature is being rolled out and will appear in all instances within a few weeks.

summary.title: Scheduled Export for Looker
summary.summary: Looker now supports scheduled daily exports, ensuring zero downtime. This feature is rolling out over the next few weeks.

2025-11-19.content: Now available in preview, the [**Self-service Explore**](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/exploring-self-service) feature lets Looker users upload CSV, XLS, and XLSX files to Looker and then query and visualize the data in a Looker Explore without needing to configure a LookML model or set up Git version control.

summary.title: Self-service Explore Now in Preview
summary.summary: Looker users can now upload spreadsheet files and explore the data without LookML or Git setup.

2025-11-05.content:
Looker 25.20 contains the following accessibility improvements:

* The character count for the custom message field of a schedule is now accessible to screen readers.
* The text for errors on custom filters is now accessible to screen readers.
* The list of visualization types in the Visualization section of an Explore is now accessible to screen readers.
* The reload button and corresponding "last refreshed" timestamp on a dashboard are now accessible to screen readers.
* The timezone selector on an Explore is now accessible to screen readers.
* The sort indicators in an Explore are now accessible to screen readers.
* The text formatting options in the Series tab of an Explore are now accessible to screen readers.
* Contrast is improved for elements that are selected when you set up dashboard filters.
* Contrast is improved for fields that are selected when Looker suggests a field name in the table calculations editor.
* Contrast is improved for tabs that are selected on the Schedule Delivery dialog.
* Contrast is improved for radio buttons that are selected on dialogs such as the download dialog.
* Dashboard filter options are no longer incorrectly classified as dialogs.
* The drill links in a single value visualization are now classified as buttons and can be accessed using the keyboard.
* The destination of an alert is now a required field.

summary.title: Accessibility Improvements in Looker 25.20
summary.summary: Looker 25.20 includes several accessibility enhancements, making features like custom messages, error texts, visualization types, dashboard elements, and explore options more accessible to screen readers. Additionally, contrast has been improved in various elements, including dashboard filters, table calculations, and dialog boxes, with several UI elements reclassified for better keyboard navigation and usability.

2025-11-05.content:
Looker now recognizes results from the `YEAR` function as a number and not a date in MySQL 8.4. This change replicates the behavior of MySQL 8.0 and earlier.

To undo this change for a MySQL connection, add the following parameter to the Additional JDBC parameters section: `yearIsDateType=true`

summary.title: Looker now recognizes YEAR function results as numbers in MySQL 8.4
summary.summary: Looker now treats YEAR function results as numbers in MySQL 8.4, aligning with earlier versions. To revert this, set `yearIsDateType=true` in your MySQL connection settings.

2025-11-05.content: The [Max Number of PDT Builder Connections](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connecting-to-your-db#max_number_of_pdt_builder_connections) limit has been increased from 10 to 100.

summary.title: PDT Builder Connections Limit Increased
summary.summary: The maximum number of PDT Builder connections has been increased from 10 to 100.

2025-11-05.content: When you use [Elite System Activity](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/elite-system-activity), the System Activity fields `sql_query.sql` and `sql_text.text` are limited to a length of 1.9 MB. Any data beyond the 1.9 MB limit will be truncated. (This release note was updated on November 10, 2025 to specify Elite System Activity.)

summary.title: System Activity Fields Truncation
summary.summary: System Activity fields `sql_query.sql` and `sql_text.text` are limited to 1.9 MB when using Elite System Activity. Data exceeding this limit will be truncated.

2025-11-05.content:
**Looker 25.20** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Thursday, November 6, 2025**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, November 13, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Thursday, November 6, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Tuesday, November 18, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.20 Release
summary.summary: The Looker 25.20 release is scheduled for November 2025, with deployments for both Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) beginning on November 6th. The original version will be finalized by November 13th, while the Google Cloud core version will conclude by November 18th.

2025-11-05.content: An issue has been fixed where SQL Runner could return a `NoMethodError` when trying to query a LookML model that doesn't exist in the user's development mode. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: SQL Runner Error Fixed
summary.summary: The SQL Runner 'NoMethodError' issue has been resolved. It now functions correctly when querying non-existent LookML models in development mode.

2025-11-05.content: An issue has been fixed where a measure of `type: period_over_period` could be referenced in the `sql` parameter for a measure of `type: number`. Attempting to do so now correctly displays an error in the LookML validator. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Period Over Period Measure Error Fixed
summary.summary: The LookML validator now correctly displays an error when a measure of type `period_over_period` is referenced in the `sql` parameter for a measure of type `number`. This resolves a previous issue where such references would not be properly flagged, ensuring the feature now performs as expected.

2025-11-05.content: An issue has been fixed where the **Clear field keep filter** button on an Explore could incorrectly become disabled when a user used the field search bar in the field picker. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Clear field keep filter button fixed
summary.summary: The Clear field keep filter button on an Explore can now be used as expected after a fix for an issue where it was incorrectly disabled when using the field search bar.

2025-11-05.content: The Visual Drilling feature is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > General Settings page.

summary.title: Visual Drilling Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The Visual Drilling feature has been released from Labs and is now generally available. You can find this new feature on the Admin > General Settings page.

2025-11-05.content: A new Labs feature, Internal Dashboard Theming, lets users apply predefined themes to a Looker dashboard. These themes, which are distinct from the themes that are used for embedded dashboards, can be managed by users with the `manage_internal_themes` permission.

summary.title: Internal Dashboard Theming
summary.summary: Users can now apply predefined themes to their Looker dashboards with the new Internal Dashboard Theming feature. This allows for easier customization and a more personalized user experience.

2025-11-05.content: An issue has been fixed where disabling the Favoriting LookML Dashboards Labs feature prevented users from moving LookML dashboards in folders. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: LookML dashboards can now be moved
summary.summary: Users can once again move LookML dashboards between folders after an issue with the Favoriting LookML Dashboards Labs feature has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2025-11-05.content: The Visual Drilling feature is now generally available on the Admin > General Settings page.

summary.title: Visual Drilling Now Available
summary.summary: The new Visual Drilling feature is now generally available on the Admin > General Settings page. This feature provides enhanced capabilities for data exploration and analysis.

2025-10-31.content: Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use Private Service Connect now offer a simplified method for configuring outbound connections to external domains or the Looker Marketplace. For more information, see the [Configure outbound connections](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-create-psc#configure-outbound) documentation.

summary.title: Simplified Outbound Connections for Looker
summary.summary: Looker instances using Private Service Connect now have an easier way to set up connections to external domains and the Looker Marketplace. This update simplifies the process for users needing to connect Looker to external resources.

2025-10-23.content:
**Conversational Analytics in Looker**

The following features are available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) for use with [Conversational Analytics in Looker](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/conversational-analytics-overview) instances that are running Looker 25.18 or later:

* [Event and event attribute information](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/events) is now available in [System Activity Explores](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/usage-reports-with-system-activity-explores#system_activity_explores).
* A [Conversational Analytics System Activity dashboard](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/system-activity-dashboards#conversational_analytics) is now available to surface usage data for Conversational Analytics features in Looker, including the most popular data agents, the most popular Explores that are used in conversations, and the most active users.

summary.title: Conversational Analytics Now Available
summary.summary: Conversational Analytics in Looker is now available in preview. This feature allows users to access event and event attribute information in System Activity Explores and provides a new dashboard to track usage data for Conversational Analytics features.

2025-10-23.content: Looker now supports [cloning a public Git repository using an `https://` URL](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/create-projects#cloning_a_public_git_repository_from_the_new_project_page). Looker does not support cloning Git repositories using `git://` URLs.

summary.title: Git repository cloning support
summary.summary: Looker now supports cloning public Git repositories from the new project page using an https:// URL.

2025-10-21.content: The new [Looker Status Dashboard](https://status.cloud.google.com/looker) provides real-time updates about service availability or disruptions for [Looker-hosted instances](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/choosing-hosting-option#looker-hosted-pros-cons). For more information, see the [Monitor Looker status](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/status-dashboard-help) documentation page.

summary.title: Looker Status Dashboard
summary.summary: A new dashboard provides real-time updates on Looker service availability and disruptions.

2025-10-10.content:
**Conversational Analytics in Looker**

The following features are available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) for use with [Conversational Analytics in Looker](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics-looker) instances that are running Looker 25.18.9 or later:

* New model-specific Looker permissions are available to manage and use the [Conversational Analytics data agents](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker#before-you-begin) that are created to chat with Looker Explores. You can grant these permissions to users as part of a [custom role](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#create-custom-roles), or use one of two new [default roles](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#default_roles), **Conversational Analytics Agent Manager** and **Conversational Analytics User**, to manage and use agents, respectively.
* You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent in Looker.
* Users with the `admin_agents` permission can now [share data agents](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker#share-data-agents) to let other users chat with your agent and its Explores. Starting in Looker 25.18.10, users with either the `save_agents` or the `admin_agents` permission can share data agents with other users.

(This release note was updated on October 10, 2025 to correct the Looker version for this release. This release note was updated on October 23, 2025 to correct the Looker version for data agent sharing permissions.)

summary.title: Conversational Analytics in Looker
summary.summary: Introducing new features for Conversational Analytics in Looker, now in Preview. This update includes enhanced model-specific permissions for data agents, allowing up to five Looker Explores as data sources. Additionally, data agents can now be shared, enabling collaboration and broader access to insights.

2025-10-06.content:
**Looker 25.18** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Tuesday, October 7, 2025**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, October 16, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Tuesday, October 7, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Monday, October 20, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.18 Release
summary.summary: The Looker 25.18 release is scheduled for October 2025, with deployments for both Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) beginning on October 7th.

2025-10-06.content: You can now set the Auto Resize Value setting on single value visualizations. This setting has no effect if the Smart Single Value Text Size setting is enabled on the Admin > General Settings page.

summary.title: Auto Resize Value for Single Value Visualizations
summary.summary: Users can now configure the Auto Resize Value setting for individual single value visualizations.

2025-10-06.content: The Athena JDBC driver version has been upgraded from 2.1.5 to 2.2.2. The Athena JDBC driver is used for connections to [Amazon Athena](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-amazon-athena).

summary.title: Athena JDBC Driver Update
summary.summary: The Athena JDBC driver has been upgraded to version 2.2.2.

2025-10-06.content: Conversational Analytics users with the `save_agents` permission can now [share data agents](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker), which lets other users chat with the data agent and its Explores. (This release note was added on October 9, 2025.)

summary.title: Data agents can now be shared
summary.summary: Users with the necessary permissions can now share data agents, enabling others to interact with the agent and its associated Explores.

2025-10-06.content:
Looker 25.18 contains the following accessibility improvements:

* You can navigate drill menus by using a keyboard.
* When you select a button toggle with a keyboard, the focus ring uses more contrasting colors.
* You can switch button toggles on or off by using the Enter key.
* When you use a keyboard to select a Look, dashboard, or folder that's inside a folder, a focus ring will appear around the selected item.
* You can now use a keyboard to edit boards.
* You can now use the keyboard to access LookML field definitions in the field picker.
