* The Alerts dialog is now compatible with screen readers.
* The Series tab of the visualization editor is now compatible with screen readers.
* Tile notes are now added to ARIA descriptions.
* Actions for pivot columns are now accessible with a keyboard.
* The color contrast has been improved on large text boxes such as the custom filter editor.
* The options in the visualization settings panel now have names that can be read by screen readers.
* The state of expanded dialogs on the Explore page, such as the field picker and visualization settings panel, can now be read by screen readers.

summary.title: Looker 25.18: Accessibility Improvements
summary.summary: Looker 25.18 includes several keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility enhancements, making the platform more accessible.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where, when dashboard filters were updated, column widths could resize on table visualizations that included pivoted values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Table visualizations with pivoted values now display column widths correctly after dashboard filter updates.
summary.summary: Pivoted values in table visualizations no longer cause column widths to resize unexpectedly when dashboard filters are updated. This issue has been resolved, and the feature now functions as intended.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where non-string values that were entered in the expression element of the `dynamic_fields` section of a LookML dashboard could cause the LookML validator to crash. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: LookML Validator Fix
summary.summary: Non-string values in dynamic fields no longer cause validator crashes.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where subtotal values could display incorrect values after a filter was added or updated. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Subtotal values now display correctly
summary.summary: Subtotal values may have previously displayed incorrectly after filters were applied. This has now been fixed and the feature is working as expected.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where, when dashboard filters were updated, table visualizations could get incorrectly cropped to exclude the Total row and scroll bar. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Dashboard table visualizations now display correctly
summary.summary: Table visualizations in dashboards will no longer be incorrectly cropped when filters are updated. The Total row and scroll bar will now display as expected.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where the Collapse Subtotal toggle wasn't collapsing subtotals on table visualizations. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Collapse Subtotal Toggle Fixed
summary.summary: The Collapse Subtotal toggle functionality has been fixed and now correctly collapses subtotals in table visualizations.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where the maximum column limit warning could obscure the contents of a visualization. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Visualization column limit warning fixed
summary.summary: The maximum column limit warning no longer obscures visualizations. This issue is now resolved.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where users couldn't sort tables that included pivoted values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Table sorting with pivoted values fixed
summary.summary: Users can now sort tables with pivoted values as expected. This resolves a previous issue that prevented this functionality.

2025-10-06.content: LookML dashboards that aren't deployed to production can no longer be moved into folders other than the LookML Dashboards folder.

summary.title: LookML Dashboards Deployment
summary.summary: Fixed an issue where LookML dashboards not deployed to production could be moved to folders other than the LookML Dashboards folder.

2025-10-06.content: LookML project parse errors now include the LookML file path as well as the line number of the error.

summary.title: LookML Parse Errors Improved
summary.summary: LookML project parse errors now include the LookML file path and line number.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where Databricks connections that used OAuth could not be saved if the password field was blank. You can now use OAuth without entering a password on the connections page.

summary.title: Databricks connections with OAuth can now be saved without a password
summary.summary: Fixed an issue where Databricks connections using OAuth could not be saved if the password field was blank. Users can now successfully configure these connections without needing to enter a password.

2025-10-06.content: An issue has been fixed where users were sometimes unable to add line breaks to table calculations. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Line breaks in table calculations fixed
summary.summary: Users can now add line breaks to table calculations without issues. This feature is working as expected.

2025-10-06.content:
An issue has been fixed where certain countries would not be displayed when a custom TopoJSON file was used. The following country names are now supported:

* Czechia for Czech Republic
* Eswatini for Swaziland
* Brunei Darussalam for Brunei
* North Macedonia for Macedonia
* Timor-Leste for East Timor

summary.title: Country display issue fixed
summary.summary: Fixed an issue where some countries weren't displayed with custom TopoJSON files. Supported country names now include Czechia, Eswatini, Brunei Darussalam, North Macedonia, and Timor-Leste.

2025-10-06.content: The Prerender iframes for custom visualizations feature is now generally available on the Admin > Content Guardrails page.

summary.title: Prerender iframes for custom visualizations
summary.summary: The Prerender iframes for custom visualizations feature is now generally available.

2025-10-06.content: The Smart single value text size feature is now generally available on the Admin > General Settings page.

summary.title: Smart single value text size
summary.summary: The Smart single value text size feature is now available on the Admin > General Settings page.

2025-10-06.content: The API endpoint `search_lookml_dashboards` is now generally available. This endpoint is similar to the `search_dashboards` endpoint except that it searches LookML dashboards instead of user-defined dashboards.

summary.title: LookML Dashboards Search API Now Available
summary.summary: The search_lookml_dashboards API endpoint is now generally available. It allows you to search specifically for LookML dashboards, distinguishing them from user-defined ones.

2025-10-06.content: The Data History Playback feature is now generally available on the Admin > Settings page.

summary.title: Data History Playback Now Available
summary.summary: The Data History Playback feature has been launched and is now accessible on the Admin > Settings page. This feature allows users to review past data changes and activity.

2025-10-06.content: The Reduce Filter Queries feature is now generally available on the Admin > Settings page.

summary.title: Reduce Filter Queries
summary.summary: The Reduce Filter Queries feature is now available on the Admin > Settings page.

2025-10-06.content: Looker admins can no longer create or edit individual users' API keys. Instead, from the Admin > Users page, admins can enable users to manage their own API keys. Once a user has API key management enabled, they can create, view, edit, and delete their API keys from their Looker account page. **Note:** This item was changed on October 9, 2025 to specify that it supports Looker (Google Cloud core) only, and it was changed again on October 22, 2025 to indicate that it's a breaking change.

summary.title: API key management changes for Looker admins
summary.summary: Looker admins can no longer manage individual users' API keys. Users can now manage their own API keys from their account page after admins enable this feature.

2025-10-06.content: The Prerender iframes for custom visualizations feature is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > Content Guardrails page.

summary.title: Prerender iframes for custom visualizations
summary.summary: Prerender iframes for custom visualizations are now generally available.

2025-10-06.content: The Smart single value text size feature is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > General Settings page.

summary.title: Smart single value text size feature is now generally available
summary.summary: The Smart single value text size feature is no longer in Labs and is now generally available. You can find this feature on the Admin > General Settings page.

2025-10-06.content: The API endpoint `search_lookml_dashboards` is now out of Labs and generally available. This endpoint is similar to the `search_dashboards` endpoint except that it searches LookML dashboards instead of user-defined dashboards.

summary.title: LookML Dashboards Search API Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The search_lookml_dashboards API endpoint is now generally available. This feature allows you to search LookML dashboards.

2025-10-06.content: The Data History Playback Labs feature is is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > Settings page.

summary.title: Data History Playback Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The Data History Playback feature has been released from Labs and is now generally available. You can find it on the Admin > Settings page.

2025-10-06.content: The Reduce Filter Queries Labs feature is now is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > Settings page.

summary.title: Reduce Filter Queries Now Generally Available
summary.summary: The Reduce Filter Queries feature has been released from Labs and is now generally available on the Admin > Settings page.

2025-10-02.content: The `sql_preamble` parameter now [supports Liquid statements](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-explore-sql-preamble#using_liquid_in_sql_preamble). This update is supported on Looker 25.12 and later versions.

summary.title: Liquid statements support in sql_preamble
summary.summary: The sql_preamble parameter now supports Liquid statements on Looker 25.12 and later versions.

2025-09-30.content:
The following features are coming soon for use with Conversational Analytics:

* New model-specific Looker permissions are available to [manage](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#gemini_ca_agent_manager) and [use](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#gemini_ca_agent_user) the [Conversational Analytics data agents](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker) that are created to chat with Looker Explores. You can grant these to users as part of a custom role, or use one of two new default roles, [Conversational Analytics Agent Manager](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#conversational_analytics_agent_manager) and [Conversational Analytics User](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#conversational_analytics_user), to manage and use agents, respectively.
* You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent.
* You can now [share data agents](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker#share-data-agents) to let other users chat with your agent and its Explores.

**Note:** This release note was published prematurely. It was amended on October 8, 2025 to reflect that these features are coming soon and amended on October 14, 2025 to indicate that the features [have been launched](https://docs.cloud.google.com/looker/docs/release-notes#October_10_2025).

summary.title: New features for Conversational Analytics
summary.summary: New model-specific Looker permissions are available to manage and use Conversational Analytics data agents. You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent and share data agents with other users.

2025-09-23.content: You can now [connect to your Looker instance with the Gemini CLI](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connect-ide-to-looker-using-mcp-toolbox) using a dedicated [Gemini extension](https://github.com/gemini-cli-extensions/looker). The Gemini extension can run queries, create Looks and dashboards, and retrieve elements of your LookML models.

summary.title: Gemini CLI now connects to Looker
summary.summary: Connect to your Looker instance using the Gemini CLI with a new extension. Run queries, create Looks and dashboards, and retrieve LookML model elements directly from your IDE.

2025-09-10.content:
**Looker 25.16** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Monday, September 15, 2025**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, September 25, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, September 15, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Monday, September 29, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.16 Release
summary.summary: The Looker 25.16 release is scheduled for September 2025, with deployments for both Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) beginning on September 15th. Final deployments and downloads will be available through September 29th.

2025-09-10.content: Looker no longer supports connections to Firebolt.

summary.title: Looker and Firebolt
summary.summary: Looker has ended support for Firebolt connections.

2025-09-10.content: Suggest queries now respect the concurrency limit in the connection configuration.

summary.title: Suggest queries now respect the concurrency limit
summary.summary: Suggest queries now respect the concurrency limit in the connection configuration.

2025-09-10.content: The Spanner JDBC Driver has been updated to version 2.32.1. This driver is used for connections to [Google Spanner](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-config-cloud-spanner).

summary.title: Spanner JDBC Driver Update
summary.summary: The Spanner JDBC Driver has been updated to version 2.32.1.

2025-09-10.content: The [Looker-Excel Connector](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/excel-connector) is now generally available. When your Looker admin enables the Looker-Excel Connector on the BI Connections admin page, Looker Explores display the Open in Excel option in the Explore gear menu. This option downloads the Explore results to a Windows PC in a format that Microsoft Excel recognizes.

summary.title: Looker-Excel Connector Now Available
summary.summary: The Looker-Excel Connector is now generally available. Admins can enable this feature in Looker to allow users to download Explore results directly to Microsoft Excel.

2025-09-10.content: The [LookerPower BI Connector](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/powerbi-connector) is now supported for [customer-hosted Looker instances](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/customer-hosted-installation-steps) and for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use [private connections](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#private_ip_connections). **Note:** This item was added on September 19, 2025.

summary.title: LookerPower BI Connector Now Available for Customer-Hosted and Private Connection Instances
summary.summary: The LookerPower BI Connector is now supported for customer-hosted Looker instances and for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances utilizing private connections. This expansion enhances connectivity options for users with specific deployment needs.

2025-09-10.content: The [LookerTableau BI Connector](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/tableau-connector) is now supported for [customer-hosted Looker instances](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/customer-hosted-installation-steps) and for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use [private connections](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#private_ip_connections). **Note:** This item was added on September 19, 2025.

summary.title: LookerTableau BI Connector Now Supported for Customer-Hosted and Private Instances
summary.summary: The LookerTableau BI Connector now supports customer-hosted Looker instances and Looker (Google Cloud core) instances utilizing private connections. This expansion enhances flexibility for various deployment scenarios.

2025-09-10.content:
Looker 25.16 contains the following accessibility improvements:

* Improved keyboard navigation for embed folders.
* Added ARIA labels to filter drop-down menu items.
* Added ARIA labels to schedule options.
* Added focus rings to navigation links.
* Improved VoiceOver support for filter navigation.
* Added the ability for users to close modals by using the Esc key. Users will be prevented from closing modals this way if there are unsaved changes in the modal.

summary.title: Accessibility Improvements in Looker 25.16
summary.summary: Looker 25.16 includes several accessibility enhancements, such as improved keyboard navigation, ARIA labels for filters and schedules, better VoiceOver support, and the ability to close modals with the Esc key.

2025-09-10.content: When you upload a p12 file to a database connection, Looker now checks that it is a valid file before completing the upload.

summary.title: P12 validation improved
summary.summary: Looker now validates p12 files during database connection uploads to ensure they are valid before completing the process.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where adding multiple filters to the same field could cause filter conditions to overwrite each other. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed filter bug
summary.summary: Multiple filters on the same field no longer overwrite each other.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where changing the size of a visualization could cause the visualization to flicker. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Visualization flickering issue fixed
summary.summary: The visualization flickering issue that occurred when resizing has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where users could enter color codes that were longer than six characters when they were updating custom color collections. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed color code length issue
summary.summary: Users can no longer enter color codes longer than six characters when updating custom color collections. This resolves a previous issue and ensures the feature functions correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where Explore drill links would not open correctly if cookieless embed was enabled. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Explore drill links fixed
summary.summary: Explore drill links now open correctly with cookieless embed enabled.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where generating a view inside a folder could fail if the folder's name contained special characters. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: View generation with special characters fixed
summary.summary: Generating a view inside a folder with special characters in its name will now work as expected.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where generating an embed URL from a LookML dashboard could fail with the following error: `'models' param cannot be converted to an array of String`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Embed URL generation fixed
summary.summary: The issue where generating an embed URL from a LookML dashboard could fail with an error has been resolved. The feature now works correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where loading JavaScript files for custom visualizations could take more than one second. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: JavaScript loading time improved
summary.summary: The loading time for JavaScript files used in custom visualizations has been improved and now performs as expected.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where non-admin users were unable to select a project when they added a connection. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Project Selection Issue Fixed
summary.summary: Non-admin users can now select projects when adding connections. This issue is resolved and the feature functions correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where scheduled deliveries could fail with the following error message: `Async delivery failed due to errors Internal server error. [Google Cloud Storage] undefined`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Scheduled deliveries issue fixed
summary.summary: The issue causing scheduled deliveries to fail with a Google Cloud Storage error has been resolved. Deliveries will now proceed as expected.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where subtotal rows could fail to appear in downloaded result sets. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Subtotal Rows Issue Fixed
summary.summary: An issue where subtotal rows failed to appear in downloaded result sets has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where the OAuth client secret could not be updated in the Connections page. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: OAuth Client Secret Update Fixed
summary.summary: The issue preventing updates to the OAuth client secret on the Connections page has been resolved. This functionality now operates correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where total references and row total references in table calculations could return the following error if there was no data: `Field either does not exist in the current query or is a measure.` This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Table Calculation Error
summary.summary: An issue causing errors in table calculations with no data has been resolved. Total references and row total references now function correctly.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where updating a Spanner connection could fail to save changes. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Spanner connection update issue fixed
summary.summary: An issue where updating a Spanner connection could fail to save changes has been resolved. The feature now performs as expected.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where users with only the `embed_browse_spaces` permission could be incorrectly classified as Standard users instead of Viewer users. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Permissions issue fixed
summary.summary: Users with embed_browse_spaces permission are now correctly classified as Viewer users.

2025-09-10.content: An issue has been fixed where using the `matches_filter` function in custom filters could return an error. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-10-08.content:
**Conversational Analytics in Looker**

The following features are now available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) for use with [Conversational Analytics in Looker](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics-looker) instances that are running Looker 25.18 or later:

* New model-specific Looker permissions are available to manage and use the [Conversational Analytics data agents](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker#before-you-begin) that are created to chat with Looker Explores. You can grant these permissions to users as part of a [custom role](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#create-custom-roles), or use one of two new [default roles](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#default_roles), **Conversational Analytics Agent Manager** and **Conversational Analytics User**, to manage and use agents, respectively.
* You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent in Looker.
* You can now [share data agents](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-data-agents-looker#share-data-agents) to let other users chat with your agent and its Explores.

(This release note was updated on October 9, 2025 to correct the Looker version for this release.)

summary.title: New features for Conversational Analytics in Looker
summary.summary: New features are available for Conversational Analytics in Looker, including model-specific permissions for data agents, the ability to select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent, and the option to share data agents with other users.

2025-08-13.content:
The following updates have been made for [Period-over-period (PoP) measures](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/period-over-period):

* The PoP measure feature is out of Preview and is now generally available. **Note:** This item was added on August 21, 2025.
* PoP measures are now supported for MySQL 8.0.12+ connections to Looker. **Note:** This item was added on August 18, 2025.
* You can now specify the following types of measures in the PoP measure's [`based_on`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/period-over-period#based_on) parameter: [`list`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-measure-types#list), [`median`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-measure-types#median), [`median_distinct`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-measure-types#median_distinct), [`number`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-measure-types#number), [`percentile`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-measure-types#percentile), [`percentile_distinct`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-measure-types#percentile_distinct). **Note:** This item was added on August 21, 2025.
* For queries with PoP measures and time-based filters, in order to calculate data for the PoP measure Looker now automatically retrieves an extra time period of the coarsest time granularity in the query. (Previously, the user was required to adjust the granularity of time-based filters in order to account for the PoP measure calculations.) **Note:** This item was added on August 21, 2025.
* For queries with PoP measures, if no time-based dimensions are included in the query from the Explore's field picker, Looker can now infer the time period from time-based dimensions in the Explore's filters. (Previously, for queries with PoP measures, the user was required to specify a time-based dimension from the Explore's field picker.) See [Requirements for Explore queries with PoP measures](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/period-over-period#explore-requirements) for more information. **Note:** This item was added on August 21, 2025.
* PoP measures are now supported with [Connected Sheets](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connected-sheets). **Note:** This item was added on August 21, 2025.

summary.title: PoP Measures Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Period-over-period measures are now generally available and support MySQL connections and Connected Sheets.

2025-07-25.content:
The [Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics-code-interpreter) is available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) for Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) instances. The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default.

* Looker (original) instances must be on Looker 25.8 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the [**Gemini in Looker** admin page](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-platform-gil#enable-and-disable-gil-original) of the Looker (original) instance.
* Looker (Google Cloud core) instances must be on Looker 25.10 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the [**Gemini in Looker** admin page](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-admin-gemini#enable-ci-core) of the Looker (Google Cloud core) instance.

2025-07-24.content: For faster response time for queries in BigQuery, Looker will execute BigQuery queries by using [`jobCreationMode=JOB_CREATION_OPTIONAL`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs/query#jobcreationmode). If BigQuery can return immediate results, it will run the query without creating a job, so the record in the Looker query history will have a BigQuery query ID instead of a BigQuery job ID. See the [Understanding query performance metrics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/query-performance-metrics#bigquery_bi_engine_metrics) documentation page for more information about the BigQuery BI Engine metrics.

summary.title: Faster BigQuery Queries in Looker
summary.summary: Looker now uses an improved method for running BigQuery queries, leading to faster response times.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where editing a merged query in an embedded session would open in a new tab. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.summary: Looker no longer generates duplicate SQL table references when a PDT references a table directly as well as through a join.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where some PDT regeneration events were not tracked in System Activity. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed PDT regeneration tracking
summary.summary: PDT regeneration events were not tracked in System Activity.

2025-07-24.content: When an Explore is saved as a new dashboard, Looker will create advanced filter type dashboard filters, rather than drop-down type dashboard filters, for number type parameters.

summary.title: Looker dashboard filter update
summary.summary: Looker now creates advanced filters for number parameters when saving an Explore as a dashboard.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where SAML authentication could fail for a Looker (Google Cloud core) instance. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: SAML authentication fixed
summary.summary: SAML authentication issue fixed.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where the Looker Marketplace toggle was not being displayed in Looker core instances for users who were granted Admin permissions with an IAM role. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Looker Marketplace Fix
summary.summary: Looker Marketplace toggle now displayed correctly for IAM admins.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where installing multiple drivers for the same database type on a customer-hosted instance could cause Looker to display an error. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed driver installation issue
summary.summary: An issue with installing multiple drivers for the same database type on a customer-hosted instance has been fixed.

2025-06-30.content: The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature is out of Labs and is now generally available. The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature improves the performance of [Development Mode](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/dev-mode-prod-mode#development_mode) on your instance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer clicks the [Create Developer Copy](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/git-command-reference#create-developer-copy) button for the project. **Note:** This item was added on July 8, 2025.

summary.title: Fast Dev Mode Transition Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Fast Dev Mode Transition is now generally available, improving development mode performance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer creates a copy.

2025-06-30.content: The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature is now available for Looker (Google Cloud core). The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature improves the performance of [Development Mode](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/dev-mode-prod-mode#development_mode) on your instance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer clicks the [Create Developer Copy](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/git-command-reference#create-developer-copy) button for the project. **Note:** This item was added on July 8, 2025.

summary.title: New Fast Dev Mode Transition for Looker
summary.summary: Looker's Fast Dev Mode Transition is now available, improving instance performance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer initiates a copy. This enhancement applies to Looker (Google Cloud core).

2025-06-24.content:
The following feature is generally available for Looker reports:

* The Looker connector can now connect to a [private IP (private services access) only](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#private_ip_connections) Looker (Google Cloud core) instance or to a [private IP (Private Service Connect)](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#psc) Looker (Google Cloud core) instance [using the Looker instance ID](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-connect-to-private-ip-lsp-sil).

summary.title: Looker connector supports private IP connections
summary.summary: The Looker connector now supports connecting to Looker (Google Cloud core) instances using private IP addresses, including those with Private Service Connect.

2025-06-11.content:
**Looker 25.10** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, June 26, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, June 16, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.10 Release Notes
summary.summary: Looker 25.10 release is scheduled for June 2025, with deployments for Looker (original) starting June 17th and Looker (Google Cloud core) starting June 16th. Final deployments and downloads will be available by June 26th for original and June 30th for Google Cloud core.

2025-06-11.content:
The [Embed SDK](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/embed-sdk-intro) has been upgraded to release 2.0.0. While the 2.0.0 API is backwards-compatible with Embed SDK 1.8.x, the underlying implementation has changed for some functionality. SDK 1.8.x exported a number of classes. SDK 2.0.0 replaces these classes with interfaces that are marked as deprecated (alternative interfaces are identified). We recommend that applications use the interfaces that have an 'I' prefix (the interfaces that have prefixes are identical to the interfaces that don't have them). Applications that are upgraded to SDK 2.0.0 should continue to work and behave as they did previously. To take advantage of the API improvements, some refactoring will be required. The following major changes are included in Embed SDK 2.0.0:

* Navigating between dashboards, Explores, and Looks no longer requires that an iframe be recreated. Instead, the `loadDashboard`, `loadLook`, `loadExplore`, and `loadUrl` methods can be used to navigate within the Looker iframe.
* `connect` now returns a unified connection rather than a connection that is related only to a dashboard, a Look, or an Explore. The unified connection allows embedding applications to detect a user navigating inside the iframe.
* Support for additional Looker embedded content has been added for Looker reports and query visualizations.

**Note:** This item was added on June 13, 2025.

summary.title: Embed SDK upgraded to 2.0.0
summary.summary: The Embed SDK has been upgraded to version 2.0.0. This new version is backward-compatible with 1.8.x but introduces changes to how classes are exported, recommending the use of interfaces instead. Key improvements include eliminating the need to recreate iframes for navigation, a unified connection object for better event detection, and expanded support for Looker reports and query visualizations. Some refactoring may be needed to leverage the new features.

2025-06-11.content: For period-over-period (PoP) measures, a new subparameter, [`value_to_date`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/period-over-period#value_to_date), is available. When a PoP measure is defined with `value_to_date:yes`, Looker will calculate the amount of time in the current timeframe at the time that the query is run and apply that amount of time when it calculates the values for previous periods.

summary.title: New subparameter for period-over-period measures
summary.summary: Looker's period-over-period measures now support a `value_to_date` subparameter. This allows for more accurate calculations of previous periods by considering the current timeframe when the query is executed.

2025-06-11.content: The new Content Guardrails admin panel lets Looker admins limit both the ability for users to add or execute merged results queries on dashboards and the use of the dashboard auto-refresh option. Limiting merged results queries and dashboard auto-refreshes can reduce the number of queries that are sent to the database and improve dashboard performance. **Note:** This item was added on June 12, 2025.

summary.title: Control Merged Results and Auto-Refresh
summary.summary: Looker admins can now control user access to merged results queries and dashboard auto-refresh functionality. This feature helps reduce database load and enhance dashboard performance by limiting query execution.

2025-06-11.content: The Looker [Continuous Integration (CI)](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/continuous-integration) features let you run tests on your LookML project to deliver more reliable, efficient, and user-friendly data experiences. You can use the CI validators to catch issues with SQL, data test, content, and LookML before they hit production to verify your LookML and prevent query errors for your users. You can also configure the CI validators to run automatically when a pull request is submitted to your LookML repository. **Note:** This item was added on June 23, 2025.

summary.title: Looker CI Features
summary.summary: Looker's new Continuous Integration features enable automated testing of your LookML projects, catching SQL, data test, content, and LookML issues before they reach production. This ensures more reliable and user-friendly data experiences by preventing query errors.

2025-06-11.content:
This release contains the following accessibility improvements:

* Increased contrast ratio for graphic elements, including icon bullets
* Improved contrast for download links and unemphasized text to comply with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) Level AA

summary.title: Accessibility Improvements
summary.summary: This release includes accessibility improvements such as increased contrast for graphic elements and links, ensuring compliance with WCAG Level AA standards.

2025-06-11.content: The Tile Actions kebab menu now includes the name of the dashboard tile in its `aria-label` value.

summary.title: Accessibility improvements for Tile Actions menu
summary.summary: The Tile Actions kebab menu's aria-label now includes the dashboard tile's name for improved accessibility.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where SDK API calls could return a 500 error if optional headers were not specified. The API calls now work as expected even if optional headers are not included.

summary.title: Fixed: SDK API call errors
summary.summary: SDK API calls now correctly handle missing optional headers, resolving the 500 error.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the PDT Override Service Account field was not available for connections that use OAuth credentials. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: PDT Override Service Account Field Fixed
summary.summary: The PDT Override Service Account field is now available for connections using OAuth credentials, resolving a previous issue.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the Manage Access dialog on a folder could load slowly if the Looker instance has a large number of groups. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Manage Access dialog performance improved
summary.summary: The Manage Access dialog for folders now loads quickly, even with a large number of groups in the Looker instance.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where, previously, testing a new OAuth connection before saving would run connection tests on an empty connection. OAuth settings must now be saved before running connection tests. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: OAuth connection testing
summary.summary: Previously, testing a new OAuth connection before saving would run connection tests on an empty connection. OAuth settings must now be saved before running connection tests. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-06-11.content: The OAuth Tenant ID field will no longer appear in connections for which it is not relevant. The only connection type that supports this field is Trino.

summary.title: OAuth Tenant ID field updated
summary.summary: The OAuth Tenant ID field is now hidden for irrelevant connections. This field is only relevant for Trino connections.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the API calls to run git connection tests would fail unless the user was in dev mode. These calls now work as expected whether the user is in production or development mode.

summary.title: Fixed git connection test API calls
summary.summary: API calls for git connection tests now function correctly in both production and development modes, resolving a previous issue where they only worked in dev mode.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where drill downs wouldn't be displayed for a field if the first field value had null values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Drill down issue fixed
summary.summary: Drill downs now display correctly even if the first field value is null.

2025-06-11.content:
An issue has been fixed where assigning the user attribute
`looker_internal_email_domain_allowlist` on the SAML config page would return a 500 error. This user attribute is not designed to be assigned at the user level, so the option to assign it has been removed from the SAML config page.

summary.title: User attribute assignment fixed
summary.summary: The ability to assign the user attribute `looker_internal_email_domain_allowlist` on the SAML config page has been removed due to a bug that caused a 500 error. This attribute is not intended for user-level assignment.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where restarting the Looker instance during a folder sync could cause the instance to fail to start.

summary.title: Looker instance startup issue fixed
summary.summary: The Looker instance could fail to start after being restarted during a folder sync. This issue has now been resolved.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where selecting fields from the Session view in the System Activity User Explore could cause fanout. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed fanout issue in System Activity User Explore
summary.summary: The fanout issue when selecting fields from the Session view in the System Activity User Explore has been resolved. This feature now functions correctly.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the `count` table calculation function could return incorrect values if its inputs included a list with null values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed incorrect calculation in `count` table function
summary.summary: The `count` table calculation function now correctly handles lists with null values, returning accurate results.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the drill menu did not properly translate some entries when the locale was set to Swedish (sv\_SE). This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Drill menu translation fixed for Swedish locale
summary.summary: The drill menu in the product now correctly translates all entries when the locale is set to Swedish.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where drilling on a query with subtotals could display incorrect values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed incorrect values in queries with subtotals
summary.summary: Drilling on a query with subtotals now displays the correct values, resolving a previous issue.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where filtering on a custom dimension that references a `datetime` type field could return the following error message: `No matching signature`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed issue with custom dimension filtering
summary.summary: Filtering on a custom dimension that references a datetime type field could return an error. This issue has now been resolved and the feature performs as expected.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the LookML validator would return a 500 error if a LookML file contained a `sum_distinct` measure for a database that doesn't support `sum_distinct` measures. The LookML validator now returns a more descriptive error message.

summary.title: Fixed LookML validator error for sum_distinct measures
summary.summary: The LookML validator no longer returns a 500 error for LookML files with `sum_distinct` measures on unsupported databases. Instead, it provides a more informative error message, improving the developer experience.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where entering the value `12:00` in the Time field of an alert schedule dialog would input `00:00` instead.

summary.title: Time field input corrected
summary.summary: The Time field in alert schedules would incorrectly display 00:00 when 12:00 was entered. This issue has now been resolved.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where changes to PDT override settings would not be saved. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed issue with PDT override settings
summary.summary: PDT override settings are now saved correctly after an issue that prevented this has been resolved. The feature is functioning as expected.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where PDTs could fail to rebuild with the following error message: `undefined method trace_id_hex`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed PDT rebuild issue
summary.summary: PDTs failing to rebuild due to an "undefined method trace_id_hex" error have been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2025-06-11.content: You can now [embed Looker reports](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/embed-reports) on Looker (original) instances when Looker reports and the Embed Looker reports Labs features are enabled for your instance. Looker reports are available in preview.

summary.title: Embedding Looker reports is now available
summary.summary: Looker reports are now available for embedding on Looker (original) instances with the relevant features enabled. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where LDAP authentication could fail with the following error message: `no implicit conversion of Hash into String`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed LDAP authentication issue
summary.summary: LDAP authentication no longer fails with a hash to string conversion error.

2025-06-11.content: The [Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics-code-interpreter) is now available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages). The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default. Admins of Looker (Google Cloud core) instances can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the [Gemini in Looker admin page](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-admin-gemini#enable-ci-core). **Note:** This item was added on June 23, 2025.

summary.title: New Code Interpreter Available for Conversational Analytics
summary.summary: A new code interpreter feature is available for conversational analytics, allowing users to translate natural language questions into Python code for advanced analysis and visualizations. This feature is disabled by default and can be managed by instance administrators.

2025-06-09.content:
Gemini in Looker will be enabled by default for Looker (original) instances that meet at least one of the following criteria:

* The Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management setting on the Settings page in the Looker Admin panel was previously enabled.
* The instance is updated to Looker 25.6 or later after June 9, 2025.

Instances that are hosted in the [EMEA region](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-original-locations) and those that are enrolled in Looker's [Extended Support Release (ESR) program](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/standard-extended-support-release-program-overview) are exempt from automatic enablement.

Looker admins can still manage Gemini in Looker enablement manually on the [Gemini in Looker](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-platform-gil) page in the Admin panel.

summary.title: Gemini in Looker enablement update
summary.summary: Gemini in Looker will be automatically enabled by default for Looker (original) instances starting with version 25.6, provided they meet specific criteria or had the feature enabled previously. However, instances in the EMEA region or those in the ESR program are exempt from this automatic enablement. Admins retain manual control over the feature

2025-06-09.content:
When the [Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-settings#gemini_default_enablement) setting is enabled, the Gemini Default Users group
is created automatically for instances that use an [open system configuration](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/access-levels#open_and_closed_systems_of_access_to_folders). The Gemini Default Users group is populated automatically with all existing users and any new users who are added to the instance.

summary.title: Automated Gemini in Looker
summary.summary: A new feature is available for Looker, regarding the Automated Gemini enablement and user management. When the relevant setting is enabled, a Gemini Default Users group is automatically created and populated with all existing and new users for instances using an open system configuration.
